Have to real about this one...  I'm generally open minded about stories / plots etc.  but after revisiting this game,  I really just cannot get behind it and admittedly only finished it because of friends' nostalgia;  They constantly hyped up this game but I just don't see it.

I had this game at launch back in the day, but didn't remember much... now I realize why.   Overall just pretty bland, and it feels all over the place.   Obviously the plot follows a character trying to remember, which should be disorienting,  but it really don't work in gameplay..  not this execution anyway.   Looking at the game generally hurts my eyes,  tons of bright white lights which suck during night time play and cut scenes that will most definitely send you to the ER if you have the slightest epilepsy.    You can call me daft if you wish,  but the story is just tough to follow at times.

I didn't play the multiplayer, so I cannot comment on that.    Dead Ops Arcade is fun, and the Zork inclusion is a nice touch, but Zombies is pretty bland without emptying your wallet for DLC.   Like the game, the DLC rarely goes down in price on PC... too expensive now for old content.

It's very rare I want to refund something,  but this is one of those times.  I wish I didn't buy this.

Pretty poor game tbh. An interesting story premise, but really hampered by the execution. Also some real immersion-destroying choices. SR-71 acting as tac air controller? 1970s/80s/90s weapons in service in the 60s? Soviet troops armed with NATO and Western weapons? All really stupid and could've been so easily avoided. 

The gameplay is pretty lacklustre as well. Now-standard COD gameplay - weapons all feel a bit samey, levels are extremely linear to the point of almost being on rails, gimmicks used to further the plot have a nasty habit of breaking the flow of things. 

Meh.

The best zombies map of all time: Kino der Toten, Black Ops 1.

To me, it's as good as it gets. It was originally supposed to be in World at War but it was cut due to time constraints. Thankfully, Treyarch was able to finish it up, polish it up, and release it with Black Ops, cause it was good. Really good. So many iconic weapons. Layout was a perfect blend of simple and complex and the enemies were all unique and fun to fight. Plus, Kino had some of the best music in any COD Zombies map ever which made it even more addicting to play through and grind over and over. Call me old school, but I think Kino is the absolute best zombies map ever released and I could play it a million times without ever getting bored.

Even though the game is overpriced and has a lot of bad reviews (because of this), my nostalgia was still hyping me up, so I bought it anyway in sale (20eu still overpriced tho lol) so I could split screen zombies with my friends. I first fired up multiplayer though and came to the conclusion that there was only one full lobby with over 100 ping (server located in America, I'm from Europe). Also I wanted to play with ps4 controller, to make it feel a bit more like it used to on the ps3, but the controls just feel so different (even when you finally map them correctly). From there I accepted that multiplayer wouldnt be my cup of tea and so I moved on to zombies. When u fire up zombies, the controller stops working completely. I couldnt figure out how to fix it, so I can't split screen with my friends like back in the day. There was one online zombies game that I managed to join (I always felt like playing alone is less fun), but again it does not feel like it used to on the ps3. So my advice is: Only buy this in sale if you only want to play zombies or campaign (with a different feel to it than console). Do not expect a perfect online experience or the possibility to easily play local with friends (which is what I and many others were enjoying years ago). This game is dead, and imo is worth max 5eu for the zombies/campaign experience. Very sad to see this is what's left of one of my favorite games ever.

Great game. Was one of my favourites back in my ps3 days. 

A couple of weird, if minor, borks though:

(1) In the 9th mission, "Victor Charlie", there's a whole segment that takes place in a dark tunnel. In this bit, all the NPCs are all in negative (as in, colour reversed, black to white and white to black). Weird.

(2) The game, the NPCs and objects in it, all seem ridiculously quick! At least on my system, which is only an i5-3570 with a GTX1060 6Gb gpu. I don't mind, but if I didn't already have an idea what was coming, having played the game before, I might find it really difficult. 

Also, there's a few amusing, minor artefacts here and there. At one point, during the mission 5 "S.O.G", I'm inside a building on the ground floor, and a Huey flew into the room, pushed me out of the way, then out again straight through a wall without damaging anything.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Call of Duty Black Ops holds a special place in the hearts of people.
From a side game mode just after the campaign, this game will always strike nostalgia in those who tried it. In my own opinion, this version of Zombies was and always will be the best.

When you try the mode for the first time, the feeling of curiosity and gentle fear approach you.

What is happening?
Why is no one else around?
Just an empty room with two staircases, and some boarded up windows...

I can't help but hear a sound from under the stairs, like something is being broken..

The slow emergence of the undead from the shadows--

and they're coming to get you.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Easily one the best Call of Duty games to date and my personal favorite. Call of Duty: Black Ops has it all, starting off with a phenomenal campaign filled with action-packed missions, memorable characters, and a story that begins the multi-platform Black Ops series all while taking place during Vietnam and just before the Cold War. Black Ops also contains multiplayer that'll knock your socks off with memorable maps such as Nuketown as well as consisting of some awesome weaponry from the Commando assault rifle to the L96A1 sniper rifle to the Python revolver. Last but certainly not least we have Zombies, some of the best maps to have ever been released come straight from Black Ops from the classic Kino Der Toten to the thrills in Call of the Dead to the unforgettable moments on Moon. Call of Duty: Black Ops will go down as one of the greatest Call of Duty games as well as one of the best first person shooters ever made. This is truly an unforgettable experience and I can't sing its praises enough. Thank you.

I've played this game for a while now and am able to write a review of it. When you purchase this game, there are three modes to play: campaign, multiplayer, and zombies. The campaign has a great story line set during the Cold War era when tensions between the Soviet Union and the United States were at an all-time high. This campaign is the predecessor to Call of Duty: Black Ops 2 sharing a similar story line. If you do finish the campaign and enjoy it, there is a probable chance you will try the successor game if you don't yet own it. Multiplayer still has an active player base but may vary depending on region and time zones. There are occasional cheaters on some servers, but they banned whenever an admin joins. Zombies is an enjoyable experience whether you have the D.L.C maps or not. You may have a difficult time finding other players to join your lobby, but it varies on your region and timing. Overall, the game still holds up more than a decade later as shown in the active player base. I would recommend to anyone considering the purchase of this game to wait until a sale period for the price to drop or the Black Ops bundle to decrease in price. The current price is a cash grab by Activision like they do to other nostalgic, popular games. To date, this is the best Call of Duty title and that is not an opinion, but a fact.

**77.8 Hours as of this review**

          To be honest, I find it rather difficult to + or - this game for it has major ups and downs. The Multiplayer appears sustained at the moment as there is a server browser. I found the Single Player campaign to be interesting. But Zombies, the selling point (to me) is undernourished as the player base even reaches flatline 0 at times, but with friends it has the ability to prove very fun. The game is obviously not worth its current price of $39.99 and should be a $19.99 as it is aged and slightly underoptimized. The DLC, I feel is overpriced as well ($14.99) but Treyarch will be Treyarch and Activision will be Activision, to my dissapointment.

EDIT: There is a server browser as previously stated, yes. However, the Multiplayer GAMEPLAY is significantly unoptimized. The slightest of detail costs 10 frames.

Edit: 
How to set fov (Single Player Only)
1. Find file path to game through steam.
2. Open Players folder
3. Open config file using a text/code editor (notepad, notepad++, VS)
4. Add,  bind U "cg_fov 90" , inside the file, U can be replaced for another key.
5. Once in game (single player), press the bound key and your fov should change. 
6. Resetting the fov can be done by either restarting the game, or by creating an additional keybind within the config file that sets the fov to default. 

Edit:
Never played the WAW remastered zombie maps until now in 2022. 
I much prefer the feel of Black Ops 1 Der Reise compared to World At War.
I am strangely more accurate... I suspect I'm just more used to the feel of bo1/bo2.
Quick revive self revive works on solo mode in the WAW remastered maps. Nice!

Controller support was not included in the PC build of the game. A controller can be used, but without aim assist. This reason alone gives me the urge to play the game on a console for nostalgia reasons. However, I am so acclimated to the PC luxuries that I resist myself. High fps, low machine noise, ability to edit files, and multitask on other programs keeps me playing on PC.

Edit 2:
Use this video to install custom zombies maps :
 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0hOLnKXYecE&ab_channel=DestinationGaming
I didn't like Kowloon, no immediate wall gun buys. I really like Battery, custom UI, new assets, wall gun buys close to beginning area.

Edit 2: 
For mutliplayer, there are no dedicated servers.
Matchmaking is done through public community servers. 
My rank was reset after grinding out to about level 20 on a handful of servers. 
I suspect this has to do with my game key and when I bought the game but I have no evidence to confirm this.
I have not figured out how to get maxrank/all unlocks as the most popular of those exploits was done through dedicated multiplayer servers and theater mode. 
The multiplayer is fun if you enjoy using the default classes or pick up other players that had not been reset guns.

T5M:
T5M as of the last time I played was inactive. 

I tried playing on my playstation 3, only found 1 game with high ping, couldn't stand the low textures and loud spinning fan of my console. 

Edit 3: 
Can't run game on mac OS, will not run 32 bit games

Edit 4: 
I got out my old xbox 360, purchased gold and signed into the multiplayer section of the game.
I only had 0d 2h 26m 14s combat record time played. Was max rank due to theater mode. I had only really played the game on ps3. Found some classes I made but they were pretty insignificant, nothing in my theater either. BO1 felt unfamiliar playing on xbox 360. I could not find a mutiplayer game on xbox live. 

Edit 5:
I finally got my old PSN account I used to play Black Ops 1 on back in my hands. When I logged in to BO1, I saw my profile for the first time in many years. I had done the theater mode process of getting max rank. 

Unfortunately because of that I do not know what my true level and true class unlocks were before. 
They are lost to time. 

My combat record remained untouched. With a astonishing 4d 16h 47s play time. 
There are 6 films in my theater mode, that I need to have recorded. Though I must purchase another device to bypass HDCP on the PS3 to do so.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

I ultimately recommend it, especially if you can get it on sale. :)

[Campaign]
----------------------------------------
The campaign on this game was very enjoyable. Took me about 30 or so hours to complete all attainable achievements for the campaign in this game. The story is really good in my opinion for a Call of Duty series game. "The numbers, Mason. What do they mean?" is from this title. Was also my first Call of Duty I bought way back on the PS3. I highly recommend this game for campaign. 

[Multiplayer]
----------------------------------------
Multiplayer I have not really got an opinion on. Servers are still around but I don't have enough playtime to really judge it. Though from the little I've played it's enjoyable still.

[Zombies] 
----------------------------------------
Zombies is pretty great on this game, though barebones in comparison to the newer titles. You get Kino der Toten and Five from the base game. Kino being the more casual map and Five being the more "pro" map. Want a casual game of Zombies? Hop on Kino. Want more of a challenge? Hop on Five. Watch out for the pentagon thief though!

[Dead Ops Arcade]
----------------------------------------
Dead Ops Arcade is a mode I haven't really played much. I've played the newer version on Black Ops Cold War but not the version in this game. I can't really judge it.

Old but gold, that's what we call basically all CoD games made by Treyarch before Black Ops III, unlike most PC games Infinity Ward ports to PC Treyarch takes the time to actually add controller support, graphics customization, and even went as far as to add more detail compared to other versions of Black Ops 1. If you take the time to actually look at some papers and even the weapons, you can actually see more detailed writing compared to the Console versions... and even more detail compared to PC CoD games made by Infinity Ward, yes really Black Ops 1 a game from 2010 has more detail than even later modern warfare games like MW2 and MW3. If there's one thing I can say it's that I out of all the CoD games on steam, avoid ones made by Infinity Ward because Treyarch compared to them actually tries with the PC version of their games. Unfortunately no new CoD game will ever come to Steam, you have to go through Activisions services like EA games for example, meaning only retro CoD games are on Steam which isn't really a bad thing because most would agree CoD stopped being original and genuinely good after Black Ops II (sometimes I say Ghosts because at least the enemies were more original there too).

About as good as it gets in the Black Ops series. 

Really, really enjoyed this campaign; it was great seeing Reznov again and meeting the new characters, but BO2 was scattered and BO3 was... well, it was definately something.

Maybe the early 2010's novelty of these games wore off for me, or perhaps I just hold the Modern Warfare series on too high of a pedastool in my mind but I was just never able to get into this series as I did with the other games.

Would I say it's worth the price? No, wait for a sale. If you're a committed CoD enjoy like myself you won't regret the purchase, again this particular instance of Black Ops was incredibly enjoyable (and the music is awesome) but the series itself isn't one to swoon over and it lacks charm, personally.

Anyway, I've had this pent up inside of me for the longest of time and I've never seen anyone really agree with me, so why not give my 2 cents?

If, out of any COD game made to be was going to made into a movie, it would either be this one or Black Ops 2.
Both games (Black Ops 1 and Black Ops 2) have the coolest piece of fiction I have probably ever consumed in a shooter game. Masons story and descent into overall madness over the sight of a mere number, or the hearing of "Kravchenko, Dragovich, Steiner" is such a huge indication on how Viktor Reznov truly won with his efforts into converting Mason into his own killing machine. I love the events of eveything leading up to the ending, with us learning all of Woods story, Masons, Hudsons, Weavers, everyone. It is such an amazing way to direct a game, and I would have it no other way.
The golden age of Call of Duty really began here.

Another great addition to the COD lineup, but it feels like you spend more time watching cinematic scenes than you do actually playing the game. In fact, I am willing to bet my COD collection that you spend more time watching cinematics than you do actually playing. Even when you do get in the game, there are a lot of times you are just sitting and listening to your other team members telling a story. Some missions are very brief, and just when they start getting to be really fun to play, the mission is over, and you get to watch another scene. Other than those setbacks, the single player story is really good, but there needs to be a way to skip them as in other releases. Without all the cinematics, you could probably finish story mode in a couple hours (if that). If I were to rate this one on a scale out of 5, I would give it a 3.5.

This game provides three modes of play. 
1.	Campaign
2.	Multiplayer
3.	Zombies
The Campaign mode offers a story driven experience wherein the player assumes control of a character and proceeds to complete in game objectives. In completing these objectives, the player obtains a greater understanding of the story which culminates in a grand finale. The story is engaging, it has character depth, the first-person play (FPS) is amazing, there is a diverse selection of weapons and there are several difficulty modes which encourages replay-ability. If you are hunting for achievements, then the campaign mode offers tons of it. Upon playing the campaign I would rate it 9/10. 

The Multiplayer mode allows the player to engage in a player vs player (PVP) mode. The players are divided into two teams and each team must work together to achieve an objective. The team that completes the first objective wins the game. As of 2022, the multiplayer support is no longer offered so it is not possible to enter competitive matches. I personally, do not enjoy PVP mode in gaming. As such for me this was not the selling point of the game. Given my personal lack of engagement and no online support I would rate this as 3/10. 

The zombies mode is a player vs environment (PVE) mode. The player spawns on a map and is given the objective of surviving hordes of zombies. The progression is marked with the number of rounds survived. Each time a set number of zombie hordes is killed the player progresses to the next round. The higher the rounds, the higher the player score and kills. The mode can be player solo or in co-op. I have thoroughly enjoyed playing zombies in black ops. For me, this is the best thing about this game. It is the reason I purchased it and should the main reason for anyone buying this game in 2022 and onwards. In solo I aim for “high round runs”. Currently, my objective is to reach round 50+ in all the zombie maps. I have accomplished round 56 in Kino and round 51 in ascension. 

The zombie mode offers a hidden storyline of sorts in form of an easter egg (EE). Once an EE is completed the player(s) are awarded with in game rewards such as longer death machine or all perks for an unlimited duration. I would recommend buying all the DLCs for black ops so that the zombie maps can be unlocked. Note that some EEs cannot be completed unless all DLCs are purchased. This is a major CON for this game, as each DLC costs an additional $15-20 (depending on the country and sale). I spent in total approximately, $75 CAD on this game. For a game which is over 10 years old the price is exorbitant. However, despite this I would highly recommend purchasing the game as it provides an unparalleled experience in zombies. My favourite zombies map is Moon. The EE is really engaging and fun. I have completed the moon EE twice in co-op and achieved all 8 perks! I plan to do the same again and aim for a round 50+ run. My rating for zombie mode is 10/10.

Overall, I would say that this game is overpriced. If you are looking to play campaign and multiplayer only then DO NOT buy this game. However, if you are really itching to play zombie mode either to experience something brand new or to re-experience it again, I would say that the price is totally worth it and to DEFINTELY BUY IT. Having said that, do wait for a sale that cuts the price of game in half and DLCs by reduction of 35%. If you do not plan on buying all the DLCs, then I suggest buying just the rezzurection DLC as it offers 5 zombie maps including moon.

TLDR; buy game and DLCs for zombies when on a sale but not for campaign or multiplayer.

Definitely in the conversation for best Call of Duty of all time. The campaign characters as well as the story are greatly recognized by the gaming community and even the folks who are against the COD franchise will typically mention that Black Ops 1 stands out. The multiplayer was amazing for it's time, however, it can be a bit difficult to find good connection in lobbies nowadays. Finally, The zombies mode arguably hit its peak in this game. BO2 has a fighting chance for that title but BO1 primarily follows the beloved main zombies cast: Edward Richtofen, Tank Dempsey, Nikolai Belinski, and Takeo Masaki who are mostly thought of as the best zombies characters for any adaption. It's a must play for any newcomer and for those who haven't touched it since 2010.

Far and away, one of the best games I've ever played. The plot is amazing with plenty of twists and turns, and zombies mode is incredibly fun, but I'd recommend playing it with a friend because fighting dozens of zombies with an AK-74U back to the wall isn't exactly great. Simply said, apart from the anachronistic weapons (The AK-74 was developed in 1974 while the game takes place from 1945-1968 and the G11 was never put into service.) and attachments (The ACOG was put into service in 1985.), I cannot find a problem with the game, and the end will really shock you.

Holy, there is so much to say about this game. This is, in my opinion, the best Call Of Duty game that I have ever played. I think Activision and Treyarch really outdid themselves with this game. I'll begin with the campaign. Black Ops is one of the most fun and interesting story's that I've ever played. It's a masterpiece. The game is an amazing blend of challenge and the shooting fun you get with the Call of Duty franchise. The story was phenomenal, the game play was great, the graphics are actually really good considering the time this game came out. I remember my first play through of this campaign. It was an absolute journey, and I'm so glad I was along for the ride. Now Zombies. This game started it all for me. This was my first zombies game, and this game is what took my breath away with zombies from the moment I first played zombies when I was 9. I can't put into words how amazing Zombies is as a mode, especially in this game. I think this game was the pinnacle of zombies as a mode, and I'm so, so very happy I was able to experience it. Unfortunately the Multiplayer had already died down by the time I was playing it so I don't have anything to say about it, but from the little I've played, I think it was my favorite multiplayer behind Cold War.

One of the best games I've played.

This time COD was taken care of (not exactly recognized by the fans) by the Treyarch development team. In Black Ops, they tries to match with more famous colleagues from Infinity Ward as best they can.

The story of Alex Mason and the people around him is told exactly as you expect - fast, adrenaline and a little confused. With the flood of information that a mysterious man behind the glass, spewing at the electric chair at the time, it is quite difficult to keep up. Conspiracies, wars, infiltrations, betrayals and unexpected meetings and farewells. This is the story of the Black Ops in a nutshell, and it must be acknowledged that there is a fairly decent B-shirt political thriller behind a certain confusion.

The interrogated Mason has to deal with memories of all the important events he has attended in the past, and the story will enrich several episodes with the other heroes of the story in the lead role. Thanks to this, the authors were not limited by time or place of narration, so in Black Ops you will see attractive places literally all over the world. Whether you find yourself in Vietnam, Laos, Russia or Cuba, you can always be sure of a spectacular spectacle. No chamber missions take place in the Black Ops, and despite a few calmer moments, a giant skirmish will always take place like a tsunami, which will not let you breathe. After all, every breath can be your last.

Multiplayer with huge options for setting up and improving your character and weapons is saved by the average single player Black Ops. It's definitely not a bad choice for online FPS fans, but it's far from perfect. [b] 50% [/b]

Not gonna lie.... I bought this for Zombie mode.

Beyond that it still holds up as a fun game! I am going through Campaign mode again on regular difficulty and it is just as fun as it was years ago when I played it!

Now keep in mind this game is outdated and old. But that's what makes it timeless. If you're looking to snag this game, go for it. Zombies Mode still holds true better than any other black-ops zombie modes.
 I mean the whole bus idea in later games was fun and exciting, but... Kino Der Toten... that is some O.G. shiz right there. You can not recreate the vibe and feeling of it. So that alone is worth the game itself! 

The pure nostalgia from this game is immense and made me inclined to buy this in 2021. I do not regret the purchase and am glad to relive some of the feelings I had when I played this at a younger age :)

This game saved my life.

I am 41.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.
After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

Highly don't recommend playing if you haven't been able to progress before. Don't buy this game again.

I find this game rather good, it is an old game I used to play during my childhood. The only thing that is heart breaking is the fact there is so many modders on it who have ruined the game for everyone

- The Campaign by far has the Best story told in the Call of Duty Universe, can't say much for the sequels but this is the game you wanna play for the most balanced rating for all three modes. (Campaign, Multiplayer, Zombies).

- The Zombies Experience in Black Ops is an incredible upgrade from World at War, complete with a storyline, and many secret puzzle style missions (Easter-Eggs) for each map.
 It is also the game that paved the way for future generations of Zombies, which allowed it to be shaped into this great relic of gaming history.
 Other than that, it's a fun game-mode to enjoy alone or with friends.

- MP: Classic Black Ops Multiplayer, Killstreak rewards that are Actually rewarding and realistic to a good extent.
If it weren't for Latency Issues or The Above Average TTK (Especially with Pistols), this game would hands-down be the best CoD Multiplayer Experience.

I have 2k hours logged onto steam for this game, but the real number is somewhere around 4-5k because I spent more than half my time playing in offline mode (mainly to prevent steam weekly updates from crashing or closing my games during long pauses). I could care less about the game's multiplayer, and this review will only take Zombies and Campaign into account (I speedrun the two modes). The Zombies mode in this game is the strongest out of any CoD Zombies game, period. It has the perfect amount of challenge and difficult to master movement and gameplay mechanics. The campaign's story is probably one of the better known ones in the CoD franchise, but I would not buy it solely for that purpose considering that a casual playthrough will take 5 - 7 hours at most. I think if you like the traditional CoD zombies mode, you'll find great enjoyment sinking hours and hours into this game, mastering each of the maps and constantly improving your best rounds on them. The gunplay in this game still feels better than most modern CoDs with their weird recoil patterns and hard-to-see-through scopes. The lack of visual clutter combined with the minimalistic screen effects and UI is also refreshing to see every time I revisit this game. My only big issue is that Activision continues to list the game at a price tag of 40$ USD, which is totally unacceptable for a game that is more than 11 years old at the time that this review goes up.

A Legendary CoD Campaign and the Start of the Legendary Zombies Storyline. A bit aged? Sure but the story itself still holds it's own, compared to what we get today at least. It doesn't stop, over the top, dramatic, epic characters, nonstop action, epic music. Zombies in the original Black Ops still has it's charm, the original characters, quotes and weapons/perks it all hits that button for me when it comes to Zombies mode, no heavy push to go for the Easter Eggs. Call of the Dead is still my favourite zombies map. 

I won't lie, playing through the story on Veteran kicked my ass sometimes, sometimes it just seemed extremely unfair but i still got through it.

This is an incredible game to play.  Graphics are excellent!  Game play is fast and furious.  It duplicates the noise and chaos of war very well.  The yelling and explosion sound effects actually get you a bit stressed as if you are in combat.  

A few funny moments and glitches:  

- it cracks me up how the guy with the CIA consistently tells everyone he's with the CIA.  That would never happen.  He would say, "Department of Army" or "State Department."  He would N E V E R name the company in the clear.  

- I had one glitch where one Russian soldier spawned and it gave an error that said "blah blah blah has more than 120 bones" No kidding.  Apparently the Russian NPC spawned with too many freakin' bones.  That's how detailed this game is.  

- another glitch was one where all the dead soldiers stood up and froze.  It was like a scene from a Twilight Zone episode. They were all bloody but all of them, and I mean ALL of them were just standing up where they had died, but with their eyes open. Creepy and funny at the same time (see screenshot).

Personally, the glitches are the fun part of any game to me.  They really crack me up.  I don't mind them at all unless it causes me to have to replay a level. 

The only components of the game I don't like are the long transition screens and long dialogue scenes.  I want to get right to the action and the lengthy scenes are just plain boring to me.  I know they wanted to make it like a movie that you are participating in, but I like to jump into the action.  There are some transition scenes you can skip by holding space and some you can skip with left click.  But the scene where Reznov tells a long story is boring once you've heard it the first time.  That's the only part of the game that is irritating to me.  I like to jump into action with maybe a little bit of briefing but not long, drawn out dissertations prior to the action.  That's just me.  

It's a fun game you can play over and over.  Well worth the price to me.  I'm sure they'd still make a massive profit if they sold it for a bit less, but you know how that works. 

One final thing: if you've had a stressful day at work and need to work out some anger on NPC AI bots, just play the S.O.G. mission during the siege of Khe Sang and man the machine gun for a while before you stop the siege :)
